705185f-a.text:
Kent Ave., west side, at the foot of Broadway. View shown is the Brooklyn Ferry Co., to Grand Street, New York. Overhead is the Broadway Elevated Brooklyn Line.
March 24, 1931.

P.L. Sperr.

705186f-a.text:
Kent Ave., west side, north from Broadway Brooklyn. At the left, is seen a section of one of the City's Ferry Houses, no longer in use. Also seen is Broadway Brooklyn Elevated Lines, of the B.M.T. in the foreground.
and the Williamsburg Bridge in the background.
March 24, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

705187f-b.text:
(1)
Kent Ave., south of Broadway, showing in the left background, the Williamsburg Bridge. In the left background, is what remains of the Municipal Ferry, to Grand Street New York City. The pipes in the foreground, are a part of the Columbia Steel Tube Company.
March 24, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a closer angle.
March 24, 1931.
P L. Sperr.

705187f-a.text:
(1)
Kent Ave., south of Broadway, showing in the left background, the Williamsburg Bridge. In the left background, is what remains of the Municipal Ferry, to Grand Street New York City. The pipes in the foreground, are a part of the Columbia Steel Tube Company.

P L. Sperr.

705184f-a.text:
Kent Ave., (First Street) south of Broadway, showing Roosevelt Street Ferry.
January 1934.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
